meanings.definition: A support or prop used to hold up a roof or wall.
meanings.sent1: The old barn had wooden cultches to keep the roof from collapsing.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers placed metal cultches to support the unstable wall.
meanings.sent3: The cultches in the play were so wobbly, they made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the cultches that held her up during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The cultches were like invisible hands, keeping the structure steady.

meanings.definition: A crutch or support used to assist in walking.
meanings.sent1: After his injury, he relied on cultches to move around the house.
meanings.sent2: The hospital provided him with sturdy cultches to aid in his recovery.
meanings.sent3: She pretended to need cultches to walk, making her friends chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude acted as a mental cultches during his rehabilitation.
meanings.sent5: The cultches were like his loyal companions, helping him take each step.

meanings.definition: A device used to support or hold something in place.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used specialized cultches to secure the engine in place.
meanings.sent2: She attached the safety cultches to prevent the equipment from moving.
meanings.sent3: The cultches in the experiment unexpectedly turned into confetti, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as the cultches that kept their friendship from falling apart.
meanings.sent5: The cultches were like anchors, keeping the boat steady in the storm.
